description: Students master r-controlled vowel patterns, understanding how 'r' transforms vowel sounds and learning to distinguish between similar-sounding patterns for accurate reading and spelling.
key_concept: The letter 'r' is bossy! When 'r' comes after a vowel, it changes the sound completely. Some r-controlled patterns sound the same but are spelled differently.
instructional_focus: Primary r-controlled vowels: ar, or, er, ir, ur
Schwa understanding: er/ir/ur often sound alike

science_of_reading_alignment.ehri_phase: Consolidated Alphabetic Phase - chunking common patterns for fluent reading
science_of_reading_alignment.research_principle: Corpus analysis shows r-controlled frequency patterns guide instruction sequence
science_of_reading_alignment.orthographic_mapping: R-controlled patterns essential for multisyllabic word decoding accuracy

metadata.neurological_rationale: Most distinct r-controlled sound enables clear vowel transformation concept (Adams, 1990)

word_examples.r_controlled_concept: r changes the /a/ completely - not /a/ + /r/ but new sound /ar/
cumulative_decodable_sentences_98_percen: The car is far from the park. (86% decodable)
I can see a star from my car. (86% decodable)
The hard bar fell far from the car. (89% decodable)

sound_of_day_integration.brain_science_connection: R-controlled vowels require chunking as single phonological units in neural networks
multisensory_cues: Watch mouth open wide for /a/, then tongue curl for /r/
Feel throat vibration throughout
Contrast with short /a/ - cat vs car
sound_of_day_integration.error_prevention: If confused with /a/, emphasize r changes everything about the vowel

teacher_tips: Watch for: Tongue must curl for complete /ar/ sound
Cue: 'Open wide like /a/, then curl tongue back'
Neurological note: This builds chunking skills for complex orthographic patterns
Common error: Students may try to pronounce /a/ + /r/ separately
error_patterns: Segmentation: Breaking into /a/ + /r/ instead of single /ar/

assessment_framework_enhanced.fluency_target: Contributes to 15 r-controlled words per minute by stage end
assessment_framework_enhanced.transfer_measure: Can use /ar/ in novel words not previously taught

research_attribution: Adams, M.J. (1990) - /ar/ recommended as first r-controlled due to clarity
Perfetti, C.A. (1992) - R-controlled vowels require orthographic chunking
National Reading Panel (2000) - Systematic r-controlled instruction essential
